gbvision.models.shapes module¶

gbvision.models.shapes.circle_collision(circ1: Tuple[Tuple[Union[int, float], Union[int, float]], Union[int, float]], circ2: Tuple[Tuple[Union[int, float], Union[int, float]], Union[int, float]]) → bool[source]¶

detects if two circles are colliding

Parameters

  • circ1 – the first circle

  • circ2 – the second circle

Returns

True if circles are colliding, False otherwise

gbvision.models.shapes.convex_shape_collision(shape1: Union[List[Tuple[Union[int, float], Union[int, float]]], numpy.ndarray], shape2: Union[List[Tuple[Union[int, float], Union[int, float]]], numpy.ndarray]) → bool[source]¶

detects collision between two convex shapes Note: if you are uncertain if a shape is convex, use convex_hull on it, it will make it convex

Parameters

  • shape1 – the first shape, as a contour

  • shape2 – the second shape, as a contour

Returns

True if the shapes are colliding, False otherwise

gbvision.models.shapes.rect_collision(r1: Tuple[Union[int, float], Union[int, float], Union[int, float], Union[int, float]], r2: Tuple[Union[int, float], Union[int, float], Union[int, float], Union[int, float]]) → bool[source]¶

detects if two rects are colliding

Parameters

  • r1 – the first rect

  • r2 – the second rect

Returns

True if the rects are colliding, False otherwise

gbvision.models.shapes.rotated_rect_collision(rr1: Tuple[Tuple[Union[int, float], Union[int, float]], Tuple[Union[int, float], Union[int, float]], float], rr2: Tuple[Tuple[Union[int, float], Union[int, float]], Tuple[Union[int, float], Union[int, float]], float]) → bool[source]¶

detects if two rotated rects are colliding

Parameters

  • rr1 – the first rotated rect

  • rr2 – the second rotated rect

Returns

True if the shapes are colliding, False otherwise
